when we leave the context manager.

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix a few more minor nitpicks. (#72)

1.  Remove dependencies from the targets that don't need them.
2.  Remove a totally unnecessary typedef.
3.  Remove unnecessary casts to float.

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Minor cleanups across the tutorials. (#71)

The main goal of this commit is to synchronize the C++ and
Python code so they look very similar to each other.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Changelog.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove the dependency on tf_transformations. (#69)

That way we don't have to install a non-standard library
(tf_transformations) that depends on a non-packaged pip
package (transforms3d) for the tutorials to work.

Note well that the function is copied twice, once in
static_turtle_tf2_broadcaster.py and once in turtle_tf2_broadcaster.py.
This is by design, as these files are used as standalone
examples in the ROS 2 tutorials.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Cleanup CI (#70)

* Get the include dirs from the target if it is available.

It will have the most up-to-date information.  Fall back
to the variable in case the target doesn't exist.

* Switch rolling CI to use 22.04.

* Fix style to conform with cpplint.

* Skip cppcheck.

It doesn't work with Rolling and Ubuntu 22.04.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Paul Bouchier
data.message: Fix wrong order of arguments to q.setRPY in commit 82964f6.

data.author: Paul Bouchier
data.message:
Fix wrong order of arguments to q.setRPY in commit 82964f6.
The API shows the order is:
void    setRPY (const tfScalar &roll, const tfScalar &pitch, const tfScalar &yaw)

Line 14 should read:

q.setRPY(0, 0, msg->theta);

This fault breaks this tutorial:

http://wiki.ros.org/tf/Tutorials/Writing%20a%20tf%20broadcaster%20%28C%2B%2B%29

In a way that doesn't show up until the subsequent tutorial, where the
follower doesn't follow. The fix to line 14 proposed above fixes the
subsequent tutorial.

The problem is discussed in this thread:

http://answers.ros.org/question/45884/turtle-tf-tutorial-fails-to-work/?answer=47845#post-id-47845

and an incorrect fix was applied to the wiki. The note in the wiki under
the code, which says the code should read:

transform.setRotation( tf::Quaternion(0, 0, msg->theta) );

is wrong - it should say transform.setRPY.
